item.author: 5by5
item.itunes:author: 5by5
item.itunes:subtitle: The Incomparable plays Trivial Pursuit.
item.description:
In a special crossover with The Incomparable's Total Party Kill podcast, we present this April Fool's Day episode featuring our panelists playing an entire Trivial Pursuit game. The whole thing. Eight players, the original Genus Edition, no waiting.

Our participants are Philip Michaels, Steve Lutz, David J. Loehr, Scott McNulty, Dan Moren, Monty Ashley, Erika Ensign, and Glenn Fleishman.

Brought to you by boats.

item.title: Episode 362: 362: Bonus Track: The Incomparable Radio Drama
item.author: 5by5
item.itunes:author: 5by5
item.itunes:subtitle: The Incomparable's radio drama dissected, plus outtakes.
item.description:
Jason Snell, David J. Loehr, Serenity Caldwell, Glenn Fleishman, Steve Lutz, and Dan Moren discuss The Incomparable's radioplay special. Plus outtakes and the original read-through of "The Fog."

Links for this episode:

  • The Intergalactic Nemesis
    Born in Austin, Texas, the world's first live graphic novel for the stage, produced radio-style with live sound effects and projections of drawing illustrating the story. A dizzy blend of Indiana Jones, the X-Files and Flash Gordon, it's got three episodes and it's on tour...
  • The Thrilling Adventure Hour
    A staged, live radio production on stage at the Coronet Theatre in Los Angeles, with occasional trips to NYC and the Sketchfest in San Francisco. Great fun, part of the Nerdist Podcast Network. Check out the cast & special guest lists--you know these people. The show was created and is written by Ben Acker & Ben Blacker, who Dan might know from their years writing Supernatural. (But only Dan will know this.)
  • CMD-SPACE 036 - Creating a Radio Drama, with Jason Snell
    This week Myke is joined by Jason Snell to discuss a recent episode of his podcast – The Incomparable – that took a step back in time, to the world of radio dramas.
  • The Fog! Fan art
  • Jumpin' Jupiter! text tone

item.title: Episode 272: 272: Incomparable Bonus: Jason Snell on Doctor Who's 2005 relaunch
item.author: 5by5
item.itunes:author: 5by5
item.itunes:subtitle: Jason Snell talks to Stephen Prescott about the "Doctor Who" 2005 revival.
item.description:
From the "A Madman With a Box" podcast, Stephen Prescott welcomes Jason Snell to discuss the episode that brought "Doctor Who" back from the dead. Jason clearly lays out the case for why “Rose” may not have known what it was or what "Doctor Who" was going to be, but it was still exactly what the show needed for its glorious comeback episode.

Links for this episode:

  • A Madman With a Box Podcast
  • "Vengeance on Varos"

item.title: Episode 263: 263: More on the Future of "Star Wars" (The Incomparable #114b)
item.author: 5by5
item.itunes:author: 5by5
item.itunes:subtitle: Even more about the future of "Star Wars"
item.description:
Following up on The Incomparable episode #114, here's a bonus discussion of the future of "Star Wars" featuring our own Dan Moren, along with guests Guy English, Dave Wiskus, Rene Ritchie, and Matt Drance. Directors, cast, crew, stories, traps, heroes' journeys, timelines, themes, theatrics, dramatics, and dreams, no topic is safe when a bunch of tech nerds get their Force talk on.

Links for this episode:

  • The Future of Star Wars Podcast
  • The Incomparable 114: When You Wish Upon a "Star Wars"
